projects.title: Autodesk's Alloy Design System
projects.description: I led development on Autodesk's Alloy React component library, building a robust, accessible, and type-safe design system used by more than 30+ feature teams. I created and maintained over 60 core components in React and TypeScript, improved Storybook documentation, and ensured design accuracy and accessibility throughout. My work established a consistent UI foundation for teams across the company that balanced full customization with ease of use.

projects.title: Alloy Table Component
projects.description: I designed and built the Alloy Table component from the ground up with performance, flexibility, and developer experience in mind. Throughout the process, I gathered developer feedback and conducted internal research to shape a composable API that supports custom cells, column grouping, sorting, selection, sticky headers, responsive layouts, and full accessibility. Now widely adopted across Autodesk, it's the standard for complex data display in all construction products.

projectDetails.title: Project Details
projectDetails.description: The Alloy Table component was a critical piece of infrastructure that needed to handle complex data display requirements across all of Autodesk's construction products. This component had to be both powerful enough for advanced use cases and simple enough for basic implementations.

projects.title: Autodesk Model Coordination's Advanced Filtering
projects.description: I developed the advanced filtering system in Autodesk Model Coordination, allowing users to isolate model elements by properties like discipline and category. I integrated filters with the Model Tree and implemented saved views to boost workflow efficiency and consistency. By combining filters with object coloring and an interactive table, I enhanced users' ability to focus on relevant data during clash detection and reviews. My work streamlined complex model navigation and improved collaboration across project revisions.
